title: Heimerdinger vs Viktor
body: I think there should be more interaction between {{champion:112}} and {{champion:74}}. They are by far the two most brilliant inventors, they both created a line of robotic champions (Battlecast for Viktor, Mecha for Heimerdinger), and they both even have a robotic arm. In my opinion, this is ripe for one of the greatest rivalries in League of Legends, but Viktor doesn't even acknowledge the Donger's existence. If Viktor thought Jayce could be a worthy ally at first because of his intelligence, why has he not even tried to convince Heimerdinger of the Glorious Evolution? In-game interactions would be nice, but I also think more of the lore should mention this.

replies.body:
Putting aside the fact that neither had interactions prior to their updates, and in Viktor's case he still has none, I suspect the reasoning behind this lack of acknowledgement is due to their characters. Both are intensely focused on their technological pursuits and generally being tolerant of anything that does not impede their work. Neither are exceedingly violent or malicious, and are generally well-adjusted members of society. Granted, Viktor's agenda is odd or disturbing from an outsider's perspective, particularly the misinformed, but he is far from dangerous.

Both are aware of the other's existence, but have no real reason to interact.

Also, Heimer does have a taunt for Viktor, but its more of an observation than clever insult.

> If you seek to replace all humans, there will be no one left to appreciate your work.

It certainly implies Heimerdinger considers Viktor's inventions to be of value.

Exactly. And his taunt shows just how little Heimer understands Viktor's work.
He's not seeking to *replace* people with inanimate objects - and his primary goal is not to be appreciated. Heimerdinger's observation is like a shallow glance, a note what it all looks like on the outside. They don't have much reason to interact, if we ignore the part that Heimer took the idea of the third arm directly from Viktor.

Viktor is clearly not just a peaceful well adjusted person of society. Viktor is currently on a line between being a disappointed and broken man and an emotionless machine intent on remaking the rest of the world into machines, whether it wishes him to or not.

If the two were to interact then it could be based on Viktor accusing Heim of seeing machines as nothing more than widgets to tinker with and discard or perhaps claim he isn't going far enough with his research. On the other hand, perhaps Heim could say Viktor has gone too far with his technology or say that organics and machines can live and work side by side.

YES. There should be.
I imagine them being friendly rivals. As in, they know they are rivals, but aren't at each other's throats. But rather, they just simply rival each other by trying to out-shine the other.

Rumble is less defined by his inventions than Heimer is and more by his desire to scrappily (HAR!) stand up to those that look down on him, yordles and other people. 

And Rumble's issues with his inventions isn't that he's a failure, it's that he's chosen to take the hard route and build his machines from junk and scrap instead of going to Piltover and gaining access to their resources. He's actually a more impressive inventor in some respects because he's been able to make his mech with what he has.

Rumble got a few interactions with trist in the super galaxy skin and the trist update.  That said, kinda sketchy how heimer didn't even have a taunt for rumble when his skin and his update came out close to one another.

I'd quite like some more interaction in general, and Heimer/Viktor would be a good place to start. But there's a risk of little happening, since Viktor already has a thing with Jayce. Still, the League has a lot of inventors, it'd be worth putting them all in a room together for a bit, so they can work on nerfing Kassadin together.
